pr_title: Add support for referencing forge's resources and specifying existing mods to data generators

timeline.message: Only automatically add forge to existing resources if forge is not one of the mods data is currently being generated for
Add --existing-mod as an argument for data generators that takes a modid and auto add forge so that mods can reference forge resources
Only automatically add forge to existing resources if forge is not one of the mods data is currently being generated for
Only automatically add forge to existing resources if forge is not one of the mods data is currently being generated for

timeline.bodyText: Why is this in the middle of the argument list?
timeline.author: TheCurle

timeline.bodyText:
Middle of the argument list..
This is a Forge class yes, but why?
timeline.author: TheCurle

replies.bodyText: Because argument wise it makes more sense going next to existing packs than at the end after a ton of random boolean values, and once we hit 1.17 and the deprecated old one can be removed without worrying that someone is calling it for some reason from somewhere else, it really won't matter as it won't be the "middle" it will just be the "normal" place for it.
replies.author: pupnewfster
